data.op2: of the acceptance of the Government of India Act, 1935 by the Congress
data.op3: it declared war on the British Empire
data.op4: it appointed Jawaharlal Nehru as the future Prime Minister of India

data.question: The Cripps Mission visited India during the regime of :

data.op1: The Indian armed forces could no longer be relied upon for their loyalty to the British
data.op2: Revolutionary activities had affected law and order system
data.op3: Large scale labour unrest and hostile public mood
data.op4: The second world war had weakened Britain economically and politically

data.question: Militant nationalism found expression for the first time on a large scale in the movement against :

“If a God were to tolerate untouchability I would not recognize him as God at all”. These words were spoken by:
The Cripps Mission failed mainly because :
data.op1: there was nothing said about a constitution making body for India
data.op2: the Congress was no longer willing to trust the ritish
data.op3: it offered a clear programme for partitioning India
data.op4: the Congress demand for effective transfer of power to Indians was not met

data.question: Which revolutionary died after a 64-day fast in jail, demanding treatment not as criminals but as political prisoners?

Consider the following statement and identify with the help of the code given below the Viceroy who made the statement and when : In my belief, Congress is tottering to its fall one of my great ambitions while in India is to assist it to a peaceful demise.
data.op1: Lord Minto, while addressing the Muslim delegation which met him at Simla in 1906
data.op2: Lord Dufferin, during the farewell speech at Calcutta
data.op3: Lord urzon, while announcing the partition of Bengal
data.op4: Lord Curzon, in a letter to the Secretary of States in 1900

data.question: The Royal Indian Navy ratings revolted in February 1946 to protest against :

data.op2: the Government’s suppression of Congress activities
data.op3: the punishment meted out to the INA officials
data.op4: the treatment meted out to them

data.op4: examine the working of the reforms of 1919
